title: Energy Development and Transformation Exercises for Body, Mind and Spirit
first_phrase: In this final section, the author delves into the energy developed within the human body, known as "sulfur," which corresponds to the hidden fire in the stone. The author advises taking potassium phosphate for maximum energy development, which is astrologically linked to Aries ♈. The text then details the corresponding care necessary for each element; for earth, exercises for muscular development, for water, exercises for emotional calmness, and for air, breathing exercises. The text concludes with exercises for developing the eye, will, and vision, which require a solid mindset and concentration. The author notes how modern science confirms the traditional benefits of mental focus in creating new mental associations.
content: Sostener el aire 20 segundos. Expirar y expirar cada vez más. Realizar cualquier simple respiración y después repetirlo dos o tres veces.  FUEGO: En fin a nivel fuego corresponden los ejercicios para desarrollar el ojo, la voluntad y la vista. Las cuatro pruebas en las Operaciones sucesivas Es fundamental que quien quiere practicar estas disciplinas tenga solidez mental. La mente no debe oscilar. El primer ejercicio fundamental para la fascinación es la concentración de la mente y consecuentemente fijación hasta el inicio de una transformación de las propias percepciones y posiblemente también otras. Esta disciplina de la concentración sobre un punto va seguida después del aprendizaje de las primeras técnicas energéticas.
last_phrase: In conclusion, by practicing these disciplines of concentration and energy techniques, we can reach a new dimension of perception and transformation. It is fundamental to have a solid mental state and focus on a fixed point to develop willpower, eye, and vision. By passing through the four different levels related to the traditional elements, we can overcome traditional primary tests and harness the power of fire, water, air, and earth. It is only through practice and discipline that we can achieve true fascination and transformation.
